page.title: 15COWLOW FARM
page.content: The farm is very old -it was built in 1845. It is about 85 hectares or 200 acres. The farm has been made much smaller since it started because of { {Tunstead Quarry.}The farm does have livestock: about 20 cows,20 sheep and poultry. The cows milk at the farm. They{don't employ any workers.}The livestock is self-produced: they don't buy anything from the outside. They make hay to feed the sheep and cows for the winter.The{wool is sent {to Bradford}at 50p per pound. On the farm they have a big hay shed then they have a loft which stores the overflow of the hay. And they have about 2 older sheds. They have sheds to keep the poultry in. The farmer enjoys his life.
